frontmatter.title: How to Calculate Mean Step by Step
frontmatter.summary: Learn how to calculate the arithmetic mean (average) of a dataset with our comprehensive step-by-step guide, including examples and common pitfalls to avoid.

seo.metaDescription: Step-by-step guide on calculating mean (average) with examples, formulas, and tips. Perfect for students and beginners.

steps.name: Gather Your Data
steps.description: Collect all the numbers you want to find the mean of. Write them down clearly. For example: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10
steps.tip: Make sure all your values are in the same units (e.g., all in meters or all in pounds)

steps.name: Count the Numbers
steps.description: Count how many numbers you have in your dataset. In our example, we have 5 numbers.
steps.warning: Don't forget to count every number, including duplicates!

steps.name: Add All Numbers
steps.description: Add all the numbers together. For our example: 2 + 4 + 6 + 8 + 10 = 30
steps.tip: Use a calculator for large datasets to avoid arithmetic errors

steps.name: Divide by Count
steps.description: Divide the sum by the count of numbers. In our example: 30 รท 5 = 6

steps.name: Verify Your Result
steps.description: Check your calculation by ensuring the mean is between your minimum and maximum values. Here, 6 is between 2 and 10, so it's correct!
steps.warning: If your mean is outside the range of your data, recheck your calculations

content: The mean is one of the most fundamental concepts in statistics, representing the average value of a dataset. This guide will walk you through calculating it manually, which helps build intuition for more complex statistical concepts.
